page.title: 19THE TOWN CRIER OF WOTTON
page.content: Our town crier is Mr George Carpenter,he became Town Crier in 1969.Wotton's first Town Crier was in 1508 until 1952. In the old days on market day in Wotton he was court constable and also jailer.He was payed 5 shillings a month.Nowa days he attends the mayor of important visitors.His suit is called regalia.It is a rust colour.He has three lace jabots and white cotton Canadian ice hockey stockings.Under his coat he has a waistcoat laced at the back.On his hat is sheeps wool.On his cloak are the coat of arms embroidered leaves and also the rose of England.His bell is between 120 and 130 years old.He takes part in a lot of competitions he belongs to the guild of 52 town criers.He has been to Canada 7 times to take part in the world championship,but has never won.
